punctuation.p: The semi-colon that seaparates character names from their descriptions in the character description page (Personebeschriewung) are not kept; these were rendered as a <list> element.

Regarding punctuation in the Dramatis Personae: The original punctuation was kept, since one of the early users of the corpus was interested in these marks. The play uses a period after character names (and role descriptions if applicable)

hyphenation.p: End-of-line hyphens that do not belong to the word itself (that are there to split it across two lines for printing purposes) are removed.
Hyphens that are part of the same token (as with clitics in Alsatian) are kept wherever they appear.
